description: An empty casing from a .55 Boys round.  These are exceptionally rare, so you might want to hold onto these.

Based off .50 BMG, and necked up, .55 boys is an anti-tank rifle cartridge, used back in world war 2 by the Boys anti-tank rifle. It went obsolete rather quickly, but its a powerful cartridge nonetheless.

Based off .50 BMG, and necked up, .55 boys is an anti-tank rifle cartridge, used back in world war 2 by the Boys anti-tank rifle. It went obsolete rather quickly, but its a powerful cartridge nonetheless. As a tracer round, this one can start fires.

Based off .50 BMG, and necked up, .55 boys is an anti-tank rifle cartridge, used back in world war 2 by the Boys anti-tank rifle. It went obsolete rather quickly, but its a powerful cartridge nonetheless. The mark II is an improved loading, performing noticably better than its predecessor

Based off .50 BMG, and necked up, .55 boys is an anti-tank rifle cartridge, used back in world war 2 by the Boys anti-tank rifle. It went obsolete rather quickly, but its a powerful cartridge nonetheless. This is a rare experimental Armor Piercing Composite Rigid round, the peak of the .55 Boys' production. Sadly, it never got widely adopted thanks to better anti-tank weapons like the PIAT coming into play.
